articles.title: Rare find: interstellar visitor seen blazing through our Solar System
articles.content:
Nature, Published online: 03 July 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02141-5

articles.title: Meteorite causes rethink of how and when our solar system formed
articles.content: Rocky bodies called protoplanets were thought to have formed slightly earlier in the inner solar system than those beyond the asteroid belt, but now a meteorite from the outer solar system is rewriting that view
articles.reasoning: The article describes a scientific breakthrough in understanding the formation of our solar system, which is a positive advancement in space science and knowledge.
articles.personality_title: Meteorite discovery reshapes our story of the solar system's birth
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context**
Scientists have long believed that rocky bodies inside the asteroid belt formed earlier than those farther out in our solar system.

**What happened**
A meteorite from the outer solar system has challenged this idea, showing that these bodies formed around the same time.

**Impact**
This discovery gives us a clearer and more exciting picture of how our solar system came together billions of years ago.

**What's next**
Researchers will keep studying meteorites and space rocks to learn even more about our cosmic beginnings.

**One-sentence takeaway**
A single meteorite is helping rewrite the story of how and when the building blocks of our solar system first formed.
